[![Image 38](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/96/Approaching_Omaha.jpg/250px-Approaching_Omaha.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Approaching_Omaha.jpg)

American troops approaching [Omaha Beach](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Omaha_Beach "Omaha Beach") during the [invasion of Normandy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Overlord "Operation Overlord") on [D-Day](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Normandy_landings "Normandy landings"), 6 June 1944

On 6 June 1944 (commonly known as [D-Day](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Normandy_landings "Normandy landings")), after three years of Soviet pressure,[[271]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-rees406-274) the Western Allies [invaded northern France](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Overlord "Operation Overlord"). After reassigning several Allied divisions from Italy, they also [attacked southern France](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Dragoon "Operation Dragoon").[[272]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Weinberg_2005_695-275) These landings were successful and led to the defeat of the [German Army units in France](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Falaise_pocket "Falaise pocket"). [Paris](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paris "Paris") was [liberated](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Liberation_of_Paris "Liberation of Paris") on 25 August by the [local resistance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/French_Resistance "French Resistance") assisted by the [Free French Forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Free_French_Forces "Free French Forces"), both led by General [Charles de Gaulle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_de_Gaulle "Charles de Gaulle"),[[273]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-276) and the Western Allies continued to [push back German forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Siegfried_Line_campaign "Siegfried Line campaign") in western Europe during the latter part of the year. An attempt to advance into northern Germany spearheaded by [a major airborne operation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Market_Garden "Operation Market Garden") in the Netherlands failed.[[274]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-277) After that, the Western Allies slowly pushed into Germany, but [failed to cross the Roer river](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Queen "Operation Queen"). In Italy, the Allied advance slowed due to the [last major German defensive line](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gothic_Line "Gothic Line").[[275]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-278)

On 22 June, the Soviets launched [a strategic offensive in Belarus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Bagration "Operation Bagration") that nearly destroyed the German [Army Group Centre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Army_Group_Centre "Army Group Centre").[[276]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Zaloga_1996_7-279) Soon after that, [another Soviet strategic offensive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lvov%E2%80%93Sandomierz_offensive "Lvov–Sandomierz offensive") forced German troops from Western Ukraine and Eastern Poland. The Soviet Red Army however halted in the [Praga](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Praga "Praga") district on the other side of the [Vistula](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vistula "Vistula") and watched passively as the Germans quelled the [Warsaw Uprising](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Warsaw_Uprising "Warsaw Uprising") initiated by the [Home Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Home_Army "Home Army") (the main faction of the [Polish resistance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polish_resistance_movement_in_World_War_II "Polish resistance movement in World War II"), loyal to the non-communist government-in exile).[[277]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-280) The [national uprising](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Slovak_National_Uprising "Slovak National Uprising") in [Slovakia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Slovak_Republic_(1939%E2%80%931945) "Slovak Republic (1939–1945)") was also quelled by the Germans.[[278]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-281) The Soviet [Red Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Red_Army "Red Army")'s [strategic offensive in eastern Romania](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Second_Jassy%E2%80%93Kishinev_offensive "Second Jassy–Kishinev offensive") cut off and destroyed the [considerable German troops there](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Army_Group_South_Ukraine "Army Group South Ukraine") and triggered [a successful coup d'état in Romania](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1944_Romanian_coup_d%27%C3%A9tat "1944 Romanian coup d'état") and [in Bulgaria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1944_Bulgarian_coup_d%27%C3%A9tat "1944 Bulgarian coup d'état"), followed by those countries' shift to the Allied side.[[279]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-countrystudies.us-282)

[![Image 39](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0e/Douglas_MacArthur_lands_Leyte1.jpg/250px-Douglas_MacArthur_lands_Leyte1.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Douglas_MacArthur_lands_Leyte1.jpg)

[General](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/General_(United_States) "General (United States)")[Douglas MacArthur](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Douglas_MacArthur "Douglas MacArthur") returns to the [Philippines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Commonwealth_of_the_Philippines "Commonwealth of the Philippines") during the [Battle of Leyte](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Leyte "Battle of Leyte"), 20 October 1944

In September 1944, Soviet troops advanced into [Yugoslavia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Democratic_Federal_Yugoslavia "Democratic Federal Yugoslavia") and forced the rapid withdrawal of German Army Groups [E](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Army_Group_E "Army Group E") and [F](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Army_Group_F "Army Group F") in [Greece](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Axis_occupation_of_Greece "Axis occupation of Greece"), [Albania](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/German_occupation_of_Albania "German occupation of Albania"), and Yugoslavia to rescue them from being cut off.[[280]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Evans_2008_653-283) By this point, the communist-led [Partisans](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yugoslav_Partisans "Yugoslav Partisans") under Marshal [Josip Broz Tito](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Josip_Broz_Tito "Josip Broz Tito"), who had led an [increasingly successful guerrilla campaign](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II_in_Yugoslavia "World War II in Yugoslavia") against the occupation since 1941, controlled much of the territory of Yugoslavia and engaged in delaying efforts against German forces further south. In northern [Serbia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Territory_of_the_Military_Commander_in_Serbia "Territory of the Military Commander in Serbia"), the Soviet [Red Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Red_Army "Red Army"), with limited support from Bulgarian forces, assisted the Partisans in a joint [liberation of the capital city of Belgrade](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Belgrade_offensive "Belgrade offensive") on 20 October. A few days later, the Soviets launched a [massive assault](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Budapest_offensive "Budapest offensive") against [German-occupied](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Panzerfaust "Operation Panzerfaust") Hungary that lasted until [the fall of Budapest](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Siege_of_Budapest "Siege of Budapest") in February 1945.[[281]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-284) Unlike impressive Soviet victories in the Balkans, [bitter Finnish resistance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Continuation_War "Continuation War") to the [Soviet offensive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vyborg%E2%80%93Petrozavodsk_offensive "Vyborg–Petrozavodsk offensive") in the [Karelian Isthmus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Karelian_Isthmus "Karelian Isthmus") denied the Soviets occupation of Finland and led to a [Soviet-Finnish armistice](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moscow_Armistice "Moscow Armistice") on relatively mild conditions,[[282]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-285) although Finland was forced to [fight their German former allies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lapland_War "Lapland War").[[283]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEShirer19901085-286)

By the start of July 1944, Commonwealth forces in Southeast Asia had repelled the Japanese sieges in [Assam](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Assam "Assam"), pushing the Japanese back to the [Chindwin River](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chindwin_River "Chindwin River")[[284]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Marston_2005_120-287) while the Chinese captured Myitkyina. In September 1944, Chinese forces [captured Mount Song](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Mount_Song "Battle of Mount Song") and reopened the [Burma Road](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Burma_Road "Burma Road").[[285]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-288) In China, the Japanese had more successes, having finally [captured Changsha](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Changsha_(1944) "Battle of Changsha (1944)") in mid-June and the city of [Hengyang](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Hengyang "Battle of Hengyang") by early August.[[286]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-289) Soon after, they invaded the province of [Guangxi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guangxi "Guangxi"), winning major engagements against Chinese forces at [Guilin and Liuzhou](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Guilin%E2%80%93Liuzhou "Battle of Guilin–Liuzhou") by the end of November[[287]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-290) and successfully linking up their forces in China and Indochina by mid-December.[[288]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Drea_2003_54-291)

In the Pacific, US forces continued to push back the Japanese perimeter. In mid-June 1944, they began their [offensive against the Mariana and Palau islands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mariana_and_Palau_Islands_campaign "Mariana and Palau Islands campaign") and decisively defeated Japanese forces in the [Battle of the Philippine Sea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_the_Philippine_Sea "Battle of the Philippine Sea"). These defeats led to the resignation of the Japanese Prime Minister, [Hideki Tojo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hideki_Tojo "Hideki Tojo"), and provided the United States with air bases to launch intensive heavy bomber attacks on the Japanese home islands. In late October, American forces [invaded the Filipino island of Leyte](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Leyte "Battle of Leyte"); soon after, Allied naval forces scored another large victory in the [Battle of Leyte Gulf](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Leyte_Gulf "Battle of Leyte Gulf"), one of the largest naval battles in history.[[289]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-292)

triples.sentence: The [national uprising](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Slovak_National_Uprising "Slovak National Uprising") in [Slovakia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Slovak_Republic_(1939%E2%80%931945) "Slovak Republic (1939–1945)") was also quelled by the Germans.[[278]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-281)
triples.statement: The national uprising in Slovakia was also suppressed by the Germans.

triples.sentence: The Soviet [Red Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Red_Army "Red Army")'s [strategic offensive in eastern Romania](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Second_Jassy%E2%80%93Kishinev_offensive "Second Jassy–Kishinev offensive") cut off and destroyed the [considerable German troops there](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Army_Group_South_Ukraine "Army Group South Ukraine") and triggered [a successful coup d'état in Romania](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1944_Romanian_coup_d%27%C3%A9tat "1944 Romanian coup d'état") and [in Bulgaria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1944_Bulgarian_coup_d%27%C3%A9tat "1944 Bulgarian coup d'état"), followed by those countries' shift to the Allied side.[[279]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-countrystudies.us-282)
triples.statement: The Soviet Red Army's strategic offensive in eastern Romania destroyed German troops and triggered successful coups in Romania and Bulgaria, leading to those countries joining the Allied side.

[![Image 40](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/05/Yalta_Conference_%28Churchill%2C_Roosevelt%2C_Stalin%29_%28B%26W%29.jpg/250px-Yalta_Conference_%28Churchill%2C_Roosevelt%2C_Stalin%29_%28B%26W%29.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Yalta_Conference_(Churchill,_Roosevelt,_Stalin)_(B%26W).jpg)

[Yalta Conference](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yalta_Conference "Yalta Conference") held in February 1945, with [Winston Churchill](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Winston_Churchill "Winston Churchill"), [Franklin D. Roosevelt](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Franklin_D._Roosevelt "Franklin D. Roosevelt"), and [Joseph Stalin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseph_Stalin "Joseph Stalin")

On 16 December 1944, Germany made a last attempt to split the Allies on the Western Front by using most of its remaining reserves to launch [a massive counter-offensive in the Ardennes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_the_Bulge "Battle of the Bulge") and [along the French-German border](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Northwind_(1944) "Operation Northwind (1944)"), hoping to encircle large portions of Western Allied troops and prompt a political settlement after capturing their primary supply port at [Antwerp](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Antwerp "Antwerp"). By 16 January 1945, this offensive had been repulsed with no strategic objectives fulfilled.[[290]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-parkerxiii-293) In Italy, the Western Allies remained stalemated at the German defensive line. In mid-January 1945, the Red Army attacked in Poland, [pushing from the Vistula to the Oder](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vistula%E2%80%93Oder_offensive "Vistula–Oder offensive") river in Germany, and [overran East Prussia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/East_Prussian_offensive "East Prussian offensive").[[291]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-294) On 4 February Soviet, British, and US leaders met for the [Yalta Conference](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yalta_Conference "Yalta Conference"). They agreed on the occupation of post-war Germany, and on when the Soviet Union would join the war against Japan.[[292]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-295)

In February, the Soviets [entered Silesia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Silesian_offensives "Silesian offensives") and [Pomerania](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/East_Pomeranian_offensive "East Pomeranian offensive"), while the [Western Allies entered western Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Western_Allied_invasion_of_Germany "Western Allied invasion of Germany") and closed to the [Rhine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rhine "Rhine") river. By March, the Western Allies crossed the Rhine [north](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Plunder "Operation Plunder") and [south](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Remagen "Remagen") of the [Ruhr](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ruhr_(river) "Ruhr (river)"), [encircling the German Army Group B](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ruhr_pocket "Ruhr pocket").[[293]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-296) In early March, in an attempt to protect its last oil reserves in Hungary and retake Budapest, Germany launched [its last major offensive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Spring_Awakening "Operation Spring Awakening") against Soviet troops near [Lake Balaton](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lake_Balaton "Lake Balaton"). Within two weeks, the offensive had been repulsed, the Soviets advanced to [Vienna](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vienna_offensive "Vienna offensive"), and captured the city. In early April, Soviet troops [captured Königsberg](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_K%C3%B6nigsberg "Battle of Königsberg"), while the Western Allies finally [pushed forward in Italy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spring_1945_offensive_in_Italy "Spring 1945 offensive in Italy") and swept across western Germany capturing [Hamburg](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Capture_of_Hamburg "Capture of Hamburg") and [Nuremberg](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Nuremberg_(1945) "Battle of Nuremberg (1945)"). [American and Soviet forces met at the Elbe river](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elbe_Day "Elbe Day") on 25 April, leaving unoccupied pockets in southern Germany and around Berlin.

Soviet troops [stormed and captured Berlin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Berlin "Battle of Berlin") in late April.[[294]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEKershaw2001793%E2%80%93829-297) In Italy, [German forces surrendered](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Surrender_of_Caserta "Surrender of Caserta") on 29 April, while the [Italian Social Republic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italian_Social_Republic "Italian Social Republic") capitulated two days later. On 30 April, the [Reichstag](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reichstag_building "Reichstag building") was captured, signalling the military defeat of Nazi Germany.[[295]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Shepardson_1998-298)

Major changes in leadership occurred on both sides during this period. On 12 April, President Roosevelt died and was succeeded by his vice president, [Harry S. Truman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_S._Truman "Harry S. Truman").[[296]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-299) Benito Mussolini [was killed](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Death_of_Benito_Mussolini "Death of Benito Mussolini") by [Italian partisans](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italian_resistance_movement "Italian resistance movement") on 28 April.[[297]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-O'Reilly_2001_244-300) On 30 April, [Hitler committed suicide](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Death_of_Adolf_Hitler "Death of Adolf Hitler") in his [headquarters](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/F%C3%BChrerbunker "Führerbunker"), and was succeeded by [Grand Admiral](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grand_Admiral "Grand Admiral")[Karl Dönitz](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Karl_D%C3%B6nitz "Karl Dönitz") (as [President of the Reich](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/President_of_Germany_(1919%E2%80%931945) "President of Germany (1919–1945)")) and [Joseph Goebbels](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseph_Goebbels "Joseph Goebbels") (as [Chancellor of the Reich](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chancellor_of_the_Reich "Chancellor of the Reich")). Goebbels also committed suicide on the following day and was replaced by [Lutz Graf Schwerin von Krosigk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lutz_Graf_Schwerin_von_Krosigk "Lutz Graf Schwerin von Krosigk"), in what would later be known as the [Flensburg Government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flensburg_Government "Flensburg Government"). [Total and unconditional surrender](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/German_Instrument_of_Surrender "German Instrument of Surrender") in Europe was signed [on 7 and 8 May](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Victory_in_Europe_Day "Victory in Europe Day"), to be effective by the end of [8 May](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Victory_Day_(9_May) "Victory Day (9 May)").[[298]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Evans_2008_737-301) German Army Group Centre [resisted in Prague](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prague_offensive "Prague offensive") until 11 May.[[299]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Glantz_1998_34-302) On 23 May all remaining members of the German government were arrested by Allied forces in [Flensburg](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flensburg "Flensburg"). On 5 June all German political and military institutions were placed under Allied control through the [Berlin Declaration](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Berlin_Declaration_(1945) "Berlin Declaration (1945)").[[300]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-303)

In the Pacific theatre, American forces accompanied by the forces of the [Philippine Commonwealth](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Commonwealth_of_the_Philippines "Commonwealth of the Philippines") advanced [in the Philippines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philippines_campaign_(1944%E2%80%931945) "Philippines campaign (1944–1945)"), [clearing Leyte](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Leyte "Battle of Leyte") by the end of April 1945. They [landed on Luzon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Luzon "Battle of Luzon") in January 1945 and [recaptured Manila](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Manila_(1945) "Battle of Manila (1945)") in March. Fighting continued on Luzon, [Mindanao](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Mindanao "Battle of Mindanao"), and other islands of the Philippines until the [end of the war](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/End_of_World_War_II_in_Asia "End of World War II in Asia").[[301]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-304) Meanwhile, the [United States Army Air Forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Army_Air_Forces "United States Army Air Forces") launched [a massive firebombing campaign](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Air_raids_on_Japan "Air raids on Japan") of strategic cities in Japan in an effort to destroy Japanese war industry and civilian morale. A devastating [bombing raid on Tokyo of 9–10 March](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bombing_of_Tokyo "Bombing of Tokyo") was the deadliest conventional bombing raid in history.[[302]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-305)

[![Image 41](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/94/Mamoru_Shigemitsu_signs_the_Instrument_of_Surrender%2C_officially_ending_the_Second_World_War.jpg/250px-Mamoru_Shigemitsu_signs_the_Instrument_of_Surrender%2C_officially_ending_the_Second_World_War.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Mamoru_Shigemitsu_signs_the_Instrument_of_Surrender,_officially_ending_the_Second_World_War.jpg)

Japanese foreign affairs minister [Mamoru Shigemitsu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mamoru_Shigemitsu "Mamoru Shigemitsu") signs the [Japanese Instrument of Surrender](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_Instrument_of_Surrender "Japanese Instrument of Surrender") on board [USS _Missouri_](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Missouri_(BB-63) "USS Missouri (BB-63)"), 2 September 1945

In May 1945, Australian troops [landed in Borneo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Borneo_campaign "Borneo campaign"), overrunning the oilfields there. British, American, and Chinese forces defeated the Japanese in northern [Burma](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Burma_campaign "Burma campaign") in March, and the British pushed on to reach [Rangoon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yangon "Yangon") by 3 May.[[303]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Drea_2003_57-306) Chinese forces started a counterattack in the [Battle of West Hunan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_West_Hunan "Battle of West Hunan") that occurred between 6 April and 7 June 1945. American naval and amphibious forces also moved towards Japan, taking [Iwo Jima](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Iwo_Jima "Battle of Iwo Jima") by March, and [Okinawa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Okinawa "Battle of Okinawa") by the end of June.[[304]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-307) At the same time, a naval blockade by [submarines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allied_submarines_in_the_Pacific_War "Allied submarines in the Pacific War") was strangling Japan's economy and drastically reducing its ability to supply overseas forces.[[305]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-results_of_german_and_american_submarines-308)[[306]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-309)

On 11 July, Allied leaders [met in Potsdam, Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Potsdam_Conference "Potsdam Conference"). They [confirmed earlier agreements](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Potsdam_Agreement "Potsdam Agreement") about Germany,[[307]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Williams_2006_90-310) and the American, British and Chinese governments reiterated the demand for unconditional surrender of Japan, specifically stating that "[the alternative for Japan is prompt and utter destruction](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Potsdam_Declaration "Potsdam Declaration")".[[308]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Miscamble_2007_201-311) During this conference, the United Kingdom [held its general election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1945_United_Kingdom_general_election "1945 United Kingdom general election"), and [Clement Attlee](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clement_Attlee "Clement Attlee") replaced Churchill as Prime Minister.[[309]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Miscamble_2007_203_204-312)

The call for unconditional surrender was rejected by the Japanese government, which believed it would be capable of negotiating for more favourable surrender terms.[[310]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-313) In early August, the United States [dropped atomic bombs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atomic_bombings_of_Hiroshima_and_Nagasaki "Atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki") on the Japanese cities of [Hiroshima](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hiroshima "Hiroshima") and [Nagasaki](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nagasaki "Nagasaki"). Between the two bombings, the Soviets, pursuant to the Yalta agreement, [declared war on Japan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soviet%E2%80%93Japanese_War "Soviet–Japanese War"), [invaded Japanese-held Manchuria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soviet_invasion_of_Manchuria "Soviet invasion of Manchuria") and quickly defeated the [Kwantung Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kwantung_Army "Kwantung Army"), which was the largest Japanese fighting force.[[311]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-314) These two events persuaded previously adamant Imperial Army leaders to accept surrender terms.[[312]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Pape_1993-315) The Red Army also captured the [southern part of Sakhalin Island](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soviet_invasion_of_South_Sakhalin "Soviet invasion of South Sakhalin") and the [Kuril Islands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Invasion_of_the_Kuril_Islands "Invasion of the Kuril Islands"). On the night of 9–10 August 1945, Emperor Hirohito announced his decision to accept the terms demanded by the Allies in the [Potsdam Declaration](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Potsdam_Declaration "Potsdam Declaration").[[313]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBix2000525%E2%80%93526-316) On 15 August, the Emperor communicated this decision to the Japanese people through a speech broadcast on the radio ([_Gyokuon-hōsō_](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hirohito_surrender_broadcast "Hirohito surrender broadcast"), literally "broadcast in the Emperor's voice").[[314]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBix2000526%E2%80%93528-317) On 15 August 1945, [Japan surrendered](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Surrender_of_Japan "Surrender of Japan"), with the [surrender documents](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_Instrument_of_Surrender "Japanese Instrument of Surrender") finally signed at [Tokyo Bay](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tokyo_Bay "Tokyo Bay") on the deck of the American battleship [USS _Missouri_](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Missouri_(BB-63) "USS Missouri (BB-63)") on 2 September 1945, ending the war.[[315]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Beevor_2012_776-318)

triples.sentence: On 12 April, President Roosevelt died and was succeeded by his vice president, [Harry S. Truman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_S._Truman "Harry S. Truman").[[296]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-299)
triples.statement: President Roosevelt died on April 12 and was succeeded by Vice President Harry S. Truman.

triples.statement: The bombing raid on Tokyo on March 9–10 was the deadliest conventional bombing raid in history.

Main articles: [Aftermath of World War II](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aftermath_of_World_War_II "Aftermath of World War II") and [Consequences of Nazism](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Consequences_of_Nazism "Consequences of Nazism")

[![Image 42](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b8/Proces_Neurenberg%2C_Bestanddeelnr_901-2065.jpg/250px-Proces_Neurenberg%2C_Bestanddeelnr_901-2065.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Proces_Neurenberg,_Bestanddeelnr_901-2065.jpg)

Defendants at the [Nuremberg trials](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nuremberg_trials "Nuremberg trials"), where the Allied forces prosecuted prominent members of the political, military, judicial, and economic leadership of [Nazi Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nazi_Germany "Nazi Germany") for [crimes against humanity](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crimes_against_humanity "Crimes against humanity")

The Allies established occupation administrations in [Austria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allied-occupied_Austria "Allied-occupied Austria") and [Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allied-occupied_Germany "Allied-occupied Germany"), both initially divided between western and eastern occupation zones controlled by the Western Allies and the Soviet Union, respectively. However, their paths soon diverged. In Germany, the [western](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trizone "Trizone") and [eastern occupation zones](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soviet_occupation_zone_in_Germany "Soviet occupation zone in Germany") officially ended in 1949, with the respective zones becoming separate countries, [West Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/West_Germany "West Germany") and [East Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/East_Germany "East Germany").[[316]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Wettig_2008_96_100-319) In Austria, however, occupation continued until 1955, when a joint settlement between the Western Allies and the Soviet Union permitted the reunification of Austria as a democratic state officially non-aligned with any political bloc (although in practice having better relations with the Western Allies). A [denazification](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Denazification "Denazification") program in Germany led to the prosecution of Nazi war criminals in the [Nuremberg trials](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nuremberg_trials "Nuremberg trials") and the removal of ex-Nazis from power, although this policy moved towards amnesty and re-integration of ex-Nazis into West German society.[[317]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Frei_2002_41_66-320)

Germany lost a quarter of its pre-war (1937) territory. Among the eastern territories, [Silesia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Silesia "Silesia"), [Neumark](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neumark "Neumark") and most of [Pomerania](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pomerania "Pomerania") were taken over by Poland,[[318]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Eberhardt-2015-321) and [East Prussia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/East_Prussia "East Prussia") was divided between Poland and the Soviet Union, followed by the [expulsion to Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flight_and_expulsion_of_Germans_(1944%E2%80%931950) "Flight and expulsion of Germans (1944–1950)") of the nine million Germans from these provinces,[[319]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Eberhardt-2006-322)[[320]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Eberhardt-2011-323) as well as three million Germans from the [Sudetenland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sudetenland "Sudetenland") in Czechoslovakia. By the 1950s, one-fifth of West Germans were refugees from the east. The Soviet Union also took over the Polish provinces east of the [Curzon Line](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Curzon_Line "Curzon Line"),[[321]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Eberhardt-2012-324) from which [two million Poles were expelled](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polish_population_transfers_(1944%E2%80%931946) "Polish population transfers (1944–1946)").[[320]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Eberhardt-2011-323)[[322]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-stalinswars43-325) North-east Romania,[[323]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-stalinswars55-326)[[324]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-shirer794-327) parts of eastern Finland,[[325]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-ckpipe-328) and the [Baltic states](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baltic_states "Baltic states") were [annexed into the Soviet Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soviet_re-occupation_of_the_Baltic_states_(1944) "Soviet re-occupation of the Baltic states (1944)").[[326]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Wettig_2008_20_21-329)[[327]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Senn_2007_?-330) Italy [lost its monarchy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1946_Italian_institutional_referendum "1946 Italian institutional referendum"), [colonial empire](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italian_Empire "Italian Empire"), and some [European territories](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Treaty_of_Paris_between_Italy_and_the_Allied_Powers "Treaty of Paris between Italy and the Allied Powers").[[328]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-331)

In an effort to maintain [world peace](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_peace "World peace"),[[329]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Yoder_1997_39-332) the Allies formed the [United Nations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations "United Nations"),[[330]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-333) which officially came into existence on 24 October 1945,[[331]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-334) and adopted the [Universal Declaration of Human Rights](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universal_Declaration_of_Human_Rights "Universal Declaration of Human Rights") in 1948 as a common standard for all [member nations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Member_states_of_the_United_Nations "Member states of the United Nations").[[332]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Waltz_2002-335) The [great powers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Great_powers "Great powers") that were the victors of the war—France, China, the United Kingdom, the Soviet Union, and the United States—became the [permanent members](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Permanent_members_of_the_United_Nations_Security_Council "Permanent members of the United Nations Security Council") of the UN's [Security Council](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations_Security_Council "United Nations Security Council").[[333]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-The_UN_Security_Council-336) The five permanent members remain so to the present, although there have been two seat changes, [between](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations_General_Assembly_Resolution_2758 "United Nations General Assembly Resolution 2758") the [Republic of China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taiwan "Taiwan") and the [People's Republic of China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China "China") in 1971, and between the Soviet Union and its [successor state](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Succession_of_states "Succession of states"), the [Russian Federation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russia "Russia"), following the [dissolution of the Soviet Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dissolution_of_the_Soviet_Union "Dissolution of the Soviet Union") in 1991. The alliance between the Western Allies and the Soviet Union had begun to deteriorate even before the war was over.[[334]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Kantowicz_2000_6-337)

[![Image 43](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7b/EasternBloc_BorderChange38-48.svg/250px-EasternBloc_BorderChange38-48.svg.png)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:EasternBloc_BorderChange38-48.svg)

Post-war border changes in [Central Europe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Central_Europe "Central Europe") and creation of the [Communist](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Communism "Communism")[Eastern Bloc](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eastern_Bloc "Eastern Bloc")

Besides Germany, the rest of Europe was also divided into Western and Soviet [spheres of influence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spheres_of_influence "Spheres of influence").[[335]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Trachtenberg_1999_33-338) Most eastern and central European countries fell into the [Soviet sphere](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eastern_Bloc "Eastern Bloc"), which led to the establishment of Communist-led regimes, with full or partial support of the Soviet occupation authorities. As a result, [East Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/East_Germany "East Germany"),[[336]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Applebaum_2012-339)[Poland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polish_People%27s_Republic "Polish People's Republic"), [Hungary](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hungarian_People%27s_Republic "Hungarian People's Republic"), [Romania](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Socialist_Republic_of_Romania "Socialist Republic of Romania"), [Bulgaria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/People%27s_Republic_of_Bulgaria "People's Republic of Bulgaria"), [Czechoslovakia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Czechoslovak_Socialist_Republic "Czechoslovak Socialist Republic"), and [Albania](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/People%27s_Socialist_Republic_of_Albania "People's Socialist Republic of Albania")[[337]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Naimark_2010-340) became Soviet [satellite states](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Satellite_state#Soviet_satellite_states "Satellite state"). Communist [Yugoslavia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Socialist_Federal_Republic_of_Yugoslavia "Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia") conducted a fully [independent policy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Non-Aligned_Movement "Non-Aligned Movement"), causing [tension with the Soviet Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tito%E2%80%93Stalin_split "Tito–Stalin split").[[338]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Swain_1992-341) A [communist uprising in Greece](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greek_Civil_War "Greek Civil War") was put down with Anglo-American support and the country remained aligned with the West.[[339]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-342)

Post-war division of the world was formalised by two international military alliances, the United States-led [NATO](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NATO "NATO") and the Soviet-led [Warsaw Pact](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Warsaw_Pact "Warsaw Pact").[[340]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Borstelmann_2005_318-343) The long period of political tensions and military competition between them—the [Cold War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cold_War "Cold War")—would be accompanied by an unprecedented [arms race](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arms_race "Arms race") and number of [proxy wars](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Proxy_war "Proxy war") throughout the world.[[341]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-344)

In Asia, the United States led the [occupation of Japan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Occupation_of_Japan "Occupation of Japan") and [administered Japan's former islands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trust_Territory_of_the_Pacific_Islands "Trust Territory of the Pacific Islands") in the Western Pacific, while the Soviets annexed [South Sakhalin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Sakhalin "South Sakhalin") and the [Kuril Islands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kuril_Islands "Kuril Islands").[[342]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Weinberg_2005_911-345)[Korea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Korea "Korea"), formerly [under Japanese colonial rule](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Korea_under_Japanese_rule "Korea under Japanese rule"), was [divided and occupied](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Division_of_Korea "Division of Korea") by the Soviet Union in the [North](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_Korea "North Korea") and the United States in the [South](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Korea "South Korea") between 1945 and 1948. Separate republics emerged on both sides of the 38th parallel in 1948, each claiming to be the legitimate government for all of Korea, which led ultimately to the [Korean War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Korean_War "Korean War").[[343]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-346)

In China, nationalist and communist forces resumed [the civil war](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_Civil_War "Chinese Civil War") in June 1946. Communist forces prevailed and established the People's Republic of China on the mainland, while nationalist forces retreated to [Taiwan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taiwan "Taiwan") in 1949.[[344]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Lynch_2010_12_13-347) In the Middle East, the Arab rejection of the [United Nations Partition Plan for Palestine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations_Partition_Plan_for_Palestine "United Nations Partition Plan for Palestine") and the [creation of Israel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Creation_of_Israel "Creation of Israel") marked the escalation of the [Arab–Israeli conflict](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arab%E2%80%93Israeli_conflict "Arab–Israeli conflict"). While European powers attempted to retain some or all of their [colonial empires](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colonial_empire "Colonial empire"), their losses of prestige and resources during the war rendered this unsuccessful, leading to [decolonisation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Decolonization "Decolonization").[[345]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-JMRoberts_1996_589-348)[[346]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-349)

The global economy suffered heavily from the war, although participating nations were affected differently. The United States emerged much richer than any other nation, leading to a [baby boom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mid-20th_century_baby_boom "Mid-20th century baby boom"), and by 1950 its [gross domestic product](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gross_domestic_product "Gross domestic product") per person was much greater than that of any of the other powers, and it dominated the world economy.[[347]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-350) The Allied occupational authorities pursued a policy of [industrial disarmament in Western Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allied_plans_for_German_industry_after_World_War_II "Allied plans for German industry after World War II") from 1945 to 1948.[[348]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Balabkins_1964_207-351) Due to international trade interdependencies, this policy led to an economic stagnation in Europe and delayed European recovery from the war for several years.[[349]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-352)[[350]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Balabkins_1964_208,209-353)

At the [Bretton Woods Conference](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bretton_Woods_Conference "Bretton Woods Conference") in July 1944, the Allied nations drew up an economic framework for the post-war world. The agreement created the [International Monetary Fund](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Monetary_Fund "International Monetary Fund") (IMF) and the [International Bank for Reconstruction and Development](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Bank_for_Reconstruction_and_Development "International Bank for Reconstruction and Development") (IBRD), which later became part of the [World Bank Group](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Bank_Group "World Bank Group"). The [Bretton Woods system](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bretton_Woods_system "Bretton Woods system") lasted until 1973.[[351]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-354) Recovery began with the mid-1948 [currency reform in West Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deutsche_Mark "Deutsche Mark"), and was sped up by the liberalisation of European economic policy that the US [Marshall Plan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marshall_Plan "Marshall Plan") economic aid (1948–1951) both directly and indirectly caused.[[352]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-355)[[353]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Balabkins_1964_212-356) The post-1948 West German recovery has been called the [German economic miracle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wirtschaftswunder#West_Germany "Wirtschaftswunder").[[354]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-357) Italy also experienced an [economic boom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italian_economic_miracle "Italian economic miracle")[[355]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-358) and the [French economy rebounded](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trente_Glorieuses "Trente Glorieuses").[[356]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-359) By contrast, the United Kingdom was in a state of economic ruin,[[357]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-360) and although receiving a quarter of the total Marshall Plan assistance, more than any other European country,[[358]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-361) it continued in relative economic decline for decades.[[359]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-362) The Soviet Union, despite enormous human and material losses, also experienced rapid increases in production in the immediate post-war era,[[360]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Smith_1993_32-363) having seized and transferred most of Germany's industrial plants and exacted [war reparations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II_reparations "World War II reparations") from its satellite states.[[d]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-364)[[361]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-365) Japan recovered much later.[[362]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-366) China returned to its pre-war industrial production by 1952.[[363]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-367)

section_body:
Main article: [World War II casualties](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II_casualties "World War II casualties")

Further information: [War crimes in World War II](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/War_crimes_in_World_War_II "War crimes in World War II")

[![Image 44](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d1/World_War_II_Casualties.svg/500px-World_War_II_Casualties.svg.png)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:World_War_II_Casualties.svg)

World War II deaths

Estimates for the total number of casualties in the war vary, because many deaths went unrecorded.[[364]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-368) Most suggest 60 million people died, about [20 million military personnel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_casualties_of_World_War_II "Battle casualties of World War II") and 40 million civilians.[[365]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-WWII:_C&C-369)[[366]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-370)

The Soviet Union alone lost around 27 million people during the war,[[367]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-371) including 8.7 million military and 19 million civilian deaths.[[368]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Ell&Mak_1994-372) A quarter of the total people in the Soviet Union were wounded or killed.[[369]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-373) Germany sustained 5.3 million military losses, mostly on the Eastern Front and during the final battles in Germany.[[370]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Herf_2003-374)

An estimated 11[[371]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-375) to 17 million[[372]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Niewyk45-376) civilians died as a direct or as an indirect result of Hitler's [racist policies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Racial_policy_of_Nazi_Germany "Racial policy of Nazi Germany"), including [mass killing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mass_killing "Mass killing") of [around 6 million Jews](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Holocaust "The Holocaust"), along with [Roma](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Romani_Holocaust "Romani Holocaust"), [homosexuals](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Persecution_of_homosexuals_in_Nazi_Germany "Persecution of homosexuals in Nazi Germany"), at least 1.9 million ethnic [Poles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II_casualties_of_Poland "World War II casualties of Poland")[[373]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-377)[[374]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-378) and [millions of other Slavs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II_casualties_of_the_Soviet_Union "World War II casualties of the Soviet Union") (including Russians, Ukrainians and Belarusians), and [other ethnic and minority groups](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Holocaust_victims "Holocaust victims").[[375]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-379)[[372]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Niewyk45-376) Between 1941 and 1945, more than 200,000 ethnic [Serbs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Serbs "Serbs"), along with Roma and Jews, were [persecuted and murdered](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Genocide_of_Serbs_in_the_Independent_State_of_Croatia "Genocide of Serbs in the Independent State of Croatia") by the Axis-aligned Croatian [Ustaše](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Usta%C5%A1e "Ustaše") in [Yugoslavia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yugoslavia "Yugoslavia").[[376]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-380) Concurrently, [Muslims](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bosniaks "Bosniaks") and [Croats](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Croats "Croats") were [persecuted and killed](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chetnik_war_crimes_in_World_War_II "Chetnik war crimes in World War II") by Serb nationalist [Chetniks](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chetniks "Chetniks"),[[377]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-381) with an estimated 50,000–68,000 victims (of which 41,000 were civilians).[[378]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Geiger-382) Also, more than 100,000 Poles were massacred by the [Ukrainian Insurgent Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ukrainian_Insurgent_Army "Ukrainian Insurgent Army") in the [Volhynia massacres](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Massacres_of_Poles_in_Volhynia_and_Eastern_Galicia "Massacres of Poles in Volhynia and Eastern Galicia"), between 1943 and 1945.[[379]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-383) At the same time, about 10,000–15,000 Ukrainians were killed by the Polish [Home Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Home_Army "Home Army") and other Polish units, in reprisal attacks.[[380]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-384)

[![Image 45](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/72/Nanking_bodies_1937.jpg/250px-Nanking_bodies_1937.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Nanking_bodies_1937.jpg)

Bodies of Chinese civilians killed by the [Imperial Japanese Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Imperial_Japanese_Army "Imperial Japanese Army") during the [Nanjing Massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nanjing_Massacre "Nanjing Massacre") in December 1937

In Asia and the Pacific, the number of people killed by Japanese troops remains contested. According to R.J. Rummel, the Japanese killed between 3 million and more than 10 million people, with the most probable case of almost 6,000,000 people.[[381]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-385) According to the British historian [M. R. D. Foot](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M._R._D._Foot "M. R. D. Foot"), civilian deaths are between 10 million and 20 million, whereas Chinese military casualties (killed and wounded) are estimated to be over five million.[[382]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-386) Other estimates say that up to 30 million people, most of them civilians, were killed.[[383]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-387)[[384]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-388) The most infamous Japanese atrocity was the [Nanjing Massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nanjing_Massacre "Nanjing Massacre"), in which fifty to three hundred thousand Chinese civilians were raped and murdered.[[385]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-389) Mitsuyoshi Himeta reported that 2.47 million casualties occurred during the [Three Alls policy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Three_Alls_policy "Three Alls policy"). General [Yasuji Okamura](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yasuji_Okamura "Yasuji Okamura") implemented the policy in [Hebei](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hebei "Hebei") and [Shandong](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shandong "Shandong").[[386]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-390)

Axis forces employed [biological](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Biological_warfare "Biological warfare") and [chemical weapons](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chemical_warfare "Chemical warfare"). The [Imperial Japanese Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Imperial_Japanese_Army "Imperial Japanese Army") used a variety of such weapons during its [invasion and occupation of China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Second_Sino-Japanese_War "Second Sino-Japanese War") (_see [Unit 731](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unit\_731 "Unit 731")_)[[387]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-391)[[388]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-392) and in [early conflicts against the Soviets](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battles_of_Khalkhin_Gol "Battles of Khalkhin Gol").[[389]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-393) Both the Germans and the [Japanese tested](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_human_experimentation_on_the_Chinese "Japanese human experimentation on the Chinese") such weapons against civilians,[[390]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-394) and sometimes on [prisoners of war](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prisoner_of_war "Prisoner of war").[[391]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-395)

The Soviet Union was responsible for the [Katyn massacre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Katyn_massacre "Katyn massacre") of 22,000 Polish officers,[[392]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-396) and the imprisonment or execution of [hundreds of thousands of political prisoners](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NKVD_prisoner_massacres "NKVD prisoner massacres") by the [NKVD](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NKVD "NKVD") secret police, along with [mass civilian deportations to Siberia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Population_transfer_in_the_Soviet_Union "Population transfer in the Soviet Union"), in the [Baltic states](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Occupation_of_the_Baltic_states "Occupation of the Baltic states") and [eastern Poland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Territories_of_Poland_annexed_by_the_Soviet_Union "Territories of Poland annexed by the Soviet Union") annexed by the Red Army.[[393]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-397) Soviet soldiers committed mass rapes in occupied territories, especially [in Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soviet_occupation_zone_in_Germany "Soviet occupation zone in Germany").[[394]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-398)[[395]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Bird-399) The exact number of German women and girls raped by Soviet troops during the war and occupation is uncertain, but historians estimate their numbers are likely in the hundreds of thousands, and possibly as many as two million,[[396]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-:4-400) while figures for women raped by German soldiers in the Soviet Union go as far as ten million.[[397]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-401)[[398]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-402)

The mass bombing of cities in Europe and Asia has often been called a war crime, although no [positive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Positive_law "Positive law") or specific [customary](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Customary_international_law "Customary international law")[international humanitarian law](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_humanitarian_law "International humanitarian law") with respect to [aerial warfare](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aerial_warfare "Aerial warfare") existed before or during World War II.[[399]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-403) The USAAF [bombed a total of 67 Japanese cities](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Air_raids_on_Japan "Air raids on Japan"), killing 393,000 civilians, including the [atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atomic_bombings_of_Hiroshima_and_Nagasaki "Atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki"), and destroying 65% of built-up areas.[[400]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-404)

section_path: Genocide, concentration camps, and slave labour
section_body:
Main articles: [The Holocaust](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Holocaust "The Holocaust"), [Nazi concentration camps](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nazi_concentration_camps "Nazi concentration camps"), [Extermination camp](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Extermination_camp "Extermination camp"), [Forced labour under German rule during World War II](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forced_labour_under_German_rule_during_World_War_II "Forced labour under German rule during World War II"), [Kidnapping of children by Nazi Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kidnapping_of_children_by_Nazi_Germany "Kidnapping of children by Nazi Germany"), [Nazi human experimentation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nazi_human_experimentation "Nazi human experimentation"), [Soviet war crimes §World War II](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soviet_war_crimes#World_War_II "Soviet war crimes"), [Japanese war crimes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_war_crimes "Japanese war crimes"), and [Prisoners of war in World War II](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prisoners_of_war_in_World_War_II "Prisoners of war in World War II")

[![Image 46](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7a/The_Liberation_of_Bergen-belsen_Concentration_Camp%2C_April_1945_BU4031.jpg/250px-The_Liberation_of_Bergen-belsen_Concentration_Camp%2C_April_1945_BU4031.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:The_Liberation_of_Bergen-belsen_Concentration_Camp,_April_1945_BU4031.jpg)

[Schutzstaffel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Schutzstaffel "Schutzstaffel") (SS) female camp guards removing prisoners' bodies from lorries and carrying them to a mass grave, inside the German [Bergen-Belsen concentration camp](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bergen-Belsen_concentration_camp "Bergen-Belsen concentration camp"), 1945

[Nazi Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nazi_Germany "Nazi Germany"), under the [dictatorship](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dictatorship "Dictatorship") of Adolf Hitler, was responsible for murdering about 6 million Jews in what is now known as [the Holocaust](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Holocaust "The Holocaust"). They also murdered an additional 4 million others who were deemed "[unworthy of life](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Life_unworthy_of_life "Life unworthy of life")" (including the [disabled](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Disability "Disability") and [mentally ill](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mental_disorder "Mental disorder"), [Soviet prisoners of war](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/German_atrocities_committed_against_Soviet_prisoners_of_war "German atrocities committed against Soviet prisoners of war"), [Romani](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Romani_people "Romani people"), [homosexuals](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Homosexuals "Homosexuals"), [Freemasons](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Freemasons "Freemasons"), and [Jehovah's Witnesses](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jehovah%27s_Witnesses "Jehovah's Witnesses")) as part of a program of deliberate extermination, in effect becoming a "[genocidal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Genocide "Genocide") state".[[401]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-405)[Soviet POWs were kept in especially unbearable conditions](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/German_atrocities_committed_against_Soviet_prisoners_of_war "German atrocities committed against Soviet prisoners of war"), and 3.6 million Soviet POWs out of 5.7 million died in Nazi camps during the war.[[402]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-406)[[403]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Overy_2004_568_569-407) In addition to [concentration camps](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nazi_concentration_camps "Nazi concentration camps"), [death camps](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Extermination_camp "Extermination camp") were created in Nazi Germany to exterminate people on an industrial scale. Nazi Germany extensively used [forced labourers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forced_labour_under_German_rule_during_World_War_II "Forced labour under German rule during World War II"); about 12 million [Europeans](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ostarbeiter "Ostarbeiter") from German-occupied countries were abducted and used as a slave work force in German industry, agriculture and war economy.[[404]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-compensation-408)

[![Image 47](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/26/Czeslawa_Kwoka_-_Brasse.jpg/250px-Czeslawa_Kwoka_-_Brasse.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Czeslawa_Kwoka_-_Brasse.jpg)

[Prisoner identity photograph of a Polish girl](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Czes%C5%82awa_Kwoka "Czesława Kwoka") taken by the German [SS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SS "SS") in [Auschwitz](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Auschwitz "Auschwitz").[[405]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-409) Approximately 230,000 children were held prisoner and used in forced labour and [Nazi medical experiments](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nazi_human_experimentation "Nazi human experimentation")

The Soviet [Gulag](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gulag "Gulag") became a _de facto_ system of deadly camps during 1942–1943, when wartime privation and hunger caused numerous deaths of inmates,[[406]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-410) including foreign citizens of Poland and [other countries](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Occupation_of_the_Baltic_states "Occupation of the Baltic states") occupied in 1939–1940 by the Soviet Union, as well as Axis [POWs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/German_prisoners_of_war_in_the_Soviet_Union "German prisoners of war in the Soviet Union").[[407]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-411) By the end of the war, most Soviet POWs liberated from Nazi camps and many repatriated civilians were detained in special filtration camps where they were subjected to [NKVD](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NKVD "NKVD") evaluation, and 226,127 were sent to the Gulag as real or perceived Nazi collaborators.[[408]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-412)

Japanese [prisoner-of-war camps](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prisoner-of-war_camp "Prisoner-of-war camp"), many of which were used as labour camps, also had high death rates. The [International Military Tribunal for the Far East](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Military_Tribunal_for_the_Far_East "International Military Tribunal for the Far East") found the death rate of [Western prisoners](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allied_prisoners_of_war_of_Japan "Allied prisoners of war of Japan") was 27 percent (for American POWs, 37 percent),[[409]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-413) seven times that of POWs under the Germans and Italians.[[410]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-414) While 37,583 prisoners from the UK, 28,500 from the Netherlands, and 14,473 from the United States were released after the [surrender of Japan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Surrender_of_Japan "Surrender of Japan"), the number of Chinese released was only 56.[[411]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-415)

At least five million Chinese civilians from northern China and Manchukuo were enslaved between 1935 and 1941 by the [East Asia Development Board](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/East_Asia_Development_Board "East Asia Development Board"), or _Kōain_, for work in mines and war industries. After 1942, the number reached 10 million.[[412]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-zhifen2002-416) In [Java](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java "Java"), between 4 and 10 million _[rōmusha](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/R%C5%8Dmusha "Rōmusha")_ (Japanese: "manual labourers"), were forced to work by the Japanese military. About 270,000 of these Javanese labourers were sent to other Japanese-held areas in Southeast Asia, and only 52,000 were repatriated to Java.[[413]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-indonesiaww2-417)

section_path: Advances in technology and its application
section_body:
Main article: [Technology during World War II](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Technology_during_World_War_II "Technology during World War II")

[![Image 51](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0c/Bundesarchiv_Bild_146-1978-Anh.026-01%2C_Peenem%C3%BCnde%2C_V2_beim_Start.jpg/250px-Bundesarchiv_Bild_146-1978-Anh.026-01%2C_Peenem%C3%BCnde%2C_V2_beim_Start.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Bundesarchiv_Bild_146-1978-Anh.026-01,_Peenem%C3%BCnde,_V2_beim_Start.jpg)

A [V-2 rocket](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/V-2_rocket "V-2 rocket") launched from a fixed site in [Peenemünde](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peenem%C3%BCnde "Peenemünde"), 21 June 1943

Aircraft were used for [reconnaissance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reconnaissance_aircraft "Reconnaissance aircraft"), as [fighters](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fighter_aircraft "Fighter aircraft"), [bombers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bomber "Bomber"), and [ground-support](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Close_air_support "Close air support"), and each role developed considerably. Innovations included [airlift](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Airlift "Airlift") (the capability to quickly move limited high-priority supplies, equipment, and personnel);[[433]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-EncWWII_76-437) and [strategic bombing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Strategic_bombing "Strategic bombing") (the bombing of enemy industrial and population centres to destroy the enemy's ability to wage war).[[434]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-438)[Anti-aircraft weaponry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anti-aircraft_warfare "Anti-aircraft warfare") also advanced, including defences such as [radar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Radar "Radar") and surface-to-air artillery, in particular the introduction of the [proximity fuze](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Proximity_fuze "Proximity fuze"). The use of the [jet aircraft](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jet_aircraft "Jet aircraft") was pioneered and led to jets becoming standard in air forces worldwide.[[435]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-439)

Advances were made in nearly every aspect of [naval warfare](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Naval_warfare "Naval warfare"), most notably with [aircraft carriers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aircraft_carrier "Aircraft carrier") and [submarines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Submarine "Submarine"). Although [aeronautical](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aeronautics "Aeronautics") warfare had relatively little success at the start of the war, [actions at Taranto](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Taranto "Battle of Taranto"), [Pearl Harbor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Attack_on_Pearl_Harbor "Attack on Pearl Harbor"), and the [Coral Sea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_the_Coral_Sea "Battle of the Coral Sea") established the carrier as the dominant capital ship (in place of the battleship).[[436]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-EncWWII_163-440)[[437]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-441)[[438]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-442) In the Atlantic, [escort carriers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Escort_carrier "Escort carrier") became a vital part of Allied convoys, increasing the effective protection radius and helping to close the [Mid-Atlantic gap](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mid-Atlantic_gap "Mid-Atlantic gap").[[439]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-443) Carriers were also more economical than [battleships](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battleship "Battleship") due to the relatively low cost of aircraft[[440]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-444) and because they are not required to be as heavily armoured.[[441]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-445) Submarines, which had proved to be an effective weapon during the [First World War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_I "World War I"),[[442]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Bur&Ryd_1995_15-446) were expected by all combatants to be important in the second. The British focused development on [anti-submarine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anti-submarine_warfare "Anti-submarine warfare")[weaponry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anti-submarine_weapon "Anti-submarine weapon") and tactics, such as [sonar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sonar "Sonar") and convoys, while Germany focused on improving its offensive capability, with designs such as the [Type VII submarine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Type_VII_submarine "Type VII submarine") and [wolfpack](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wolfpack_(naval_tactic) "Wolfpack (naval tactic)") tactics.[[443]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Bur&Ryd_1995_16-447) Gradually, improving Allied technologies such as the [Leigh Light](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leigh_Light "Leigh Light"), [Hedgehog](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hedgehog_(weapon) "Hedgehog (weapon)"), [Squid](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Squid_(weapon) "Squid (weapon)"), and [homing torpedoes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mark_24_mine "Mark 24 mine") proved effective against German submarines.[[444]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-448)

[![Image 52](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/88/Trinity_device_readied.jpg/250px-Trinity_device_readied.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Trinity_device_readied.jpg)

Nuclear _Gadget_ being raised to the top of the detonation "shot tower", at [Alamogordo Bombing Range](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alamogordo_Bombing_and_Gunnery_Range "Alamogordo Bombing and Gunnery Range"); [Trinity nuclear test](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trinity_(nuclear_test) "Trinity (nuclear test)"), [New Mexico](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Mexico "New Mexico"), July 1945

[Land warfare](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Land_warfare "Land warfare") changed from the static frontlines of [trench warfare](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trench_warfare "Trench warfare") of World War I, which had relied on improved [artillery](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Artillery "Artillery") that outmatched the speed of both [infantry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Infantry "Infantry") and [cavalry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cavalry "Cavalry"), to increased mobility and [combined arms](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Combined_arms "Combined arms"). The [tank](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tank "Tank"), which had been used predominantly for infantry support in the First World War, had evolved into the primary weapon.[[445]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-EncWWII_125-449) In the late 1930s, tank design was considerably more advanced than it had been during World War I,[[446]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-450) and [advances continued throughout the war](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tanks_in_World_War_II "Tanks in World War II") with increases in speed, armour and firepower.[[447]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-451)[[448]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-452) At the start of the war, most commanders thought enemy tanks should be met by tanks with superior specifications.[[449]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-EncWWII_108-453) This idea was challenged by the poor performance of the relatively light early tank guns against armour, and German doctrine of avoiding tank-versus-tank combat. This, along with Germany's use of combined arms, were among the key elements of their highly successful blitzkrieg tactics across Poland and France.[[445]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-EncWWII_125-449) Many means of [destroying tanks](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anti-tank_warfare "Anti-tank warfare"), including [indirect artillery](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indirect_fire "Indirect fire"), [anti-tank guns](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anti-tank_gun "Anti-tank gun") (both towed and [self-propelled](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Self-propelled_artillery "Self-propelled artillery")), [mines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anti-tank_mine "Anti-tank mine"), short-ranged infantry antitank weapons, and other tanks were used.[[449]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-EncWWII_108-453) Even with large-scale mechanisation, infantry remained the backbone of all forces,[[450]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-EncWWII_734-454) and throughout the war, most infantry were equipped similarly to World War I.[[451]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Comp_221-455) The portable machine gun spread, a notable example being the German [MG 34](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MG_34 "MG 34"), and various [submachine guns](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Submachine_gun "Submachine gun") which were suited to [close combat](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Close_combat "Close combat") in urban and jungle settings.[[451]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Comp_221-455) The [assault rifle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Assault_rifle "Assault rifle"), a late war development incorporating many features of the rifle and submachine gun, became the standard post-war infantry weapon for most armed forces.[[452]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-456)

Most major belligerents attempted to solve the problems of complexity and security involved in using large [codebooks](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Codebook "Codebook") for [cryptography](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography "Cryptography") by designing [ciphering](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cipher "Cipher") machines, the most well-known being the German [Enigma machine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enigma_machine "Enigma machine").[[453]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-457) Development of [SIGINT](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SIGINT "SIGINT") (_sig_ nals _int_ elligence) and [cryptanalysis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptanalysis "Cryptanalysis") enabled the countering process of decryption. Notable examples were the Allied decryption of [Japanese naval codes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_naval_codes "Japanese naval codes")[[454]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Schoenherr-458) and British [Ultra](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ultra_(cryptography) "Ultra (cryptography)"), a [pioneering method](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bombe#The_British_Bombe "Bombe") for decoding Enigma that benefited from information given to the United Kingdom by the [Polish Cipher Bureau](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cipher_Bureau_(Poland)#Gift_to_allies "Cipher Bureau (Poland)"), which had been decoding early versions of Enigma before the war.[[455]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-459) Another component of [military intelligence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Military_intelligence "Military intelligence") was [deception](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deception "Deception"), which the Allies used to great effect in operations such as [Mincemeat](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Mincemeat "Operation Mincemeat") and [Bodyguard](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Bodyguard "Operation Bodyguard").[[454]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-Schoenherr-458)[[456]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-460)

Other technological and engineering feats achieved during, or as a result of, the war include the world's first programmable computers ([Z3](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Z3_(computer) "Z3 (computer)"), [Colossus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colossus_computer "Colossus computer"), and [ENIAC](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ENIAC "ENIAC")), [guided missiles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/V-1_flying_bomb "V-1 flying bomb") and [modern rockets](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/V-2_rocket "V-2 rocket"), the [Manhattan Project](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manhattan_Project "Manhattan Project")'s development of [nuclear weapons](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nuclear_weapon "Nuclear weapon"), [operations research](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operations_research "Operations research"), the development of [artificial harbours](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mulberry_harbour "Mulberry harbour"), and [oil pipelines under the English Channel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Pluto "Operation Pluto").[[457]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-461)[[458]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-462) Although [penicillin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Penicillin "Penicillin") was discovered before the war, the [development](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/History_of_penicillin "History of penicillin")] of industrial production technology as well as the mass production and use began during the war.[[459]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-463)

triples.sentence: Other technological and engineering feats achieved during, or as a result of, the war include the world's first programmable computers ([Z3](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Z3_(computer) "Z3 (computer)"), [Colossus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colossus_computer "Colossus computer"), and [ENIAC](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ENIAC "ENIAC")), [guided missiles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/V-1_flying_bomb "V-1 flying bomb") and [modern rockets](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/V-2_rocket "V-2 rocket"), the [Manhattan Project](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manhattan_Project "Manhattan Project")'s development of [nuclear weapons](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nuclear_weapon "Nuclear weapon"), [operations research](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operations_research "Operations research"), the development of [artificial harbours](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mulberry_harbour "Mulberry harbour"), and [oil pipelines under the English Channel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Pluto "Operation Pluto").[[457]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-461)[[458]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-462)
triples.statement: Technological and engineering achievements from the war include the first programmable computers (Z3, Colossus, ENIAC), guided missiles, modern rockets, nuclear weapons via the Manhattan Project, operations research, artificial harbors, and undersea oil pipelines.

triples.sentence: Although [penicillin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Penicillin "Penicillin") was discovered before the war, the [development](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/History_of_penicillin "History of penicillin")] of industrial production technology as well as the mass production and use began during the war.[[459]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II#cite_note-463)
triples.statement: While penicillin was discovered before the war, the technology for its industrial production, along with its mass production and use, began during the war.
